description: Lysophosphatidic acid acts through GPR35 to induce tumor necrosis factor expression in macrophages.
GPR35 modulates the expression of tumor necrosis factor in macrophages.
Single-nucleotide polymorphisms in GPR35 are associated with increased risk of inflammatory bowel disease.
Transcript levels of Cyp11b1 are decreased in mice lacking GPR35, which aggravates colitis.
Administration of TNF restores Cyp11b1 expression and intestinal corticosterone production.
